text: Jeffery Deon Estus (July 4, 1956 – October 11, 2021) was an American musician and singer. He was best known as the bass player of Wham! and for writing some of George Michael's songs. He also played with Marvin Gaye, Tina Turner, Frank Zappa, George Clinton, Annie Lennox, Edgar Winter, Aaron Neville and Elton John. Estus died on October 11, 2021 at the age of 65. == Discography == === Albums === Year Album US 1989 Spell 89 === Singles === Year Title Album Peak chart positions US Hot 100 US R&B; US A.C.
